Package Util

Class MyFileHandler

java.lang.Object
Util.MyFileHandler
public class MyFileHandler extends Object
class for writing and reading binary and text files

    • writeToBinaryFile

      public static void writeToBinaryFile(String fileName, Object obj) throws FileNotFoundException, IOException
      Writes the given object to a file with the given file name
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the text file
      obj - This object is getting saved to the file
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the program finds a problem with the file
      IOException - If the program finds and IO problem with the file

    • writeArrayToBinaryFile

      public static void writeArrayToBinaryFile(String fileName, Object[] objs) throws FileNotFoundException, IOException
      Writes the objects in the given array to a file with the given file name
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the text file
      objs - These objects are getting saved to the file
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the program finds a problem with the file
      IOException - If the program finds and IO problem with the file

    • readFromBinaryFile

      public static Object readFromBinaryFile(String fileName) throws FileNotFoundException, IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Reads the first object from the file with the given file name and returns it. Whoever calls the method will need to cast it from type Object to its actual type
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the text file
      Returns:
      The object that is in the file
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the program finds a problem with the file
      IOException - If the program finds and IO problem with the file
      ClassNotFoundException - f cast the return object to a class, and it is not the correct one

    • readArrayFromBinaryFile

      public static Object[] readArrayFromBinaryFile(String fileName) throws FileNotFoundException, IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Reads all objects from the file with the given file name and returns it as an Object[]. Whoever calls the method will need to cast the Objects to their actual type
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the text file
      Returns:
      The object that is in the file as an Object array
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the program finds a problem with the file
      IOException - If the program finds and IO problem with the file
      ClassNotFoundException - If cast the return object to a class, and it is not the correct one
